instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700 Stuck on 20v 0.45A
threads.message: Another little water damage around u9080, board goes to dfu and if i revive, it gives error. stays 20v and 0.45a

threads.title: 820-01700 Stuck on 20v 0.45A
threads.message: PPBUS_G3H_SSD1_SNS i think it shows short because 10ohm to ground

threads.title: 820-01700 Stuck on 20v 0.45A
threads.message:
At least the trace to R5630 is also broken.
But the big problem is the SSD, which is probably damaged by overvoltage.

threads.title: 820-01700 Stuck on 20v 0.45A
threads.message: u think r5630 is broken line ?

threads.title: 820-01700 Stuck on 20v 0.45A
threads.message:
U9080, or mabe near filter caps, got burnt.
However, if you don't gte PPBUS_G3H, will not help mchanging burnt component only.
Find the culprit, then rebuild the trace; maybe bad R5630.
